function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 through iot devices and technologies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Security and privacy issues related to iot and cognitive radio cr technology","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on wearable devices for monitoring patients and potential inaccuracies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 crisis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of disease","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Access to medical facilities in remote locations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large amount of data collected from sensors can lead to privacy and security risks if not handled properly.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on iot for monitoring and tracking of infected individuals can lead to data accuracy and reliability issues.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on iot technology may lead to a lack of human judgment and intervention in critical healthcare decisions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 through person-to-person contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of control over the environment and workplace conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited awareness and compliance with safety guidelines","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Varying success rates of policies based on location, density, and cultural practices.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research on pandemic governance.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of the study to only architectural, urban, and public realm scales.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People not following covid-19 protocols such as maintaining six feet distance and other health protocols","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological difficulty in making people follow the protocols","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Congestion and lack of social distancing in urban spaces and social gathering areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of pandemic-resistant urban design recommendations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of measures due to lack of consideration for cultural beliefs and practices","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Evolution of crisis leading to uncertain conclusions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Congregations in public spaces increase the risk of virus transmission due to close contact and crowded environments.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on physical presence for the functioning of public spaces creates a challenge in controlling virus transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact of a complete lockdown creates pressure to design and build resilient public spaces to withstand future pandemics.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promoting development horizontally and maintaining lower density","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusive urban planning and management of multi-functional public spaces over preventive design strategies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intermixing of public realms, social spaces, and green infrastructure","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in public transportation usage leading to increased use of private vehicles","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in online shopping leading to reduced physical footfall in retail spaces","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical distancing in public spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of public spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of urban design to promote physical distancing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on online shopping as a result of in-person shopping limitations","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Link between average income, age group, and virus transmission","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges of stay-at-home orders in neighborhoods without public or private open spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Zone-based lockdown for covid-19 suppression","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for pandemic consequences in architectural and urban design education","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in social behavior and neighborhood dynamics due to covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Horizontal expansion and decentralization can lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to greater connectivity between different areas.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in income and class can lead to unequal access to safe public spaces and increased vulnerability to contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-density districts and crowded urban areas can lead to higher morbidity rates of covid-19 and increased vulnerability among older people and men.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased immunity due to physical inactivity and social distancing measures","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for increased disease transmission in densely populated areas","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on socio-economic composition of cities","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density urban areas facilitating easier transmission of communicable diseases due to increased social contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of multi-functional public spaces leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to concentration of amenities leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban spaces not designed for pandemic mitigation norms and regulations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Questioning the effectiveness of 6 feet physical distancing in urban spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of architectural practices in accommodating pandemic procedures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"}]}
